section.title: Bank Adjustment
section.para:
adjustments entering for bank accounts
bank adjustments entering new
bank accounts adjusting balances for Bank Adjustments may be entered to record Deposits or Payments. Use the Bank Adjustment functionality to enter Bank Interest, Bank Fees, miscellaneous deposits, etc. To enter a Bank Adjustment, select the "Bank Adjustment" option. The following screen will appear:
When entering a Bank Adjustment, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Specify the Bank Account you want to enter a Bank Adjustment for.
Specify the effective date of the Bank Adjustment.

Creates a user-defined reference for the Bank Adjustment. The Document reference will be posted with the General Ledger (G/L) transaction record when the Bank Adjustment is generated. This field may be used for internal tracking and auditing purposes.
Specify the monetary value of the Bank Adjustment.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without entering a Bank Adjustment, returning you to the previous screen.
Creates the Bank Adjustment and makes it available for posting from the Adjustment Edit List.

tip.para: Bank Adjustments, when marked as "Cleared," may also be posted when a Bank Account is reconciled.
